acknowledgments.summary: discovering the vulnerabilities and testing the patch

notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: ATTENTION: Remotely exploitable/low skill level to exploit.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: Chemical, Critical Manufacturing, Communications, Energy, Food and Agriculture, Transportation Systems, Water and Wastewater Systems
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: NCCIC/ICS-CERT recommends that users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: ICS-CERT reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: ICS-CERT also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available in the ICS -CERT Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies, that is available for download from the ICS-CERT web site.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to ICS-CERT for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target this vulnerability.
notes.title: Exploitability

notes.text: The client does not properly validate the input or limit the amount of resources that are utilized by an attacker, which can be used to consume more resources than are available.CVE-2017-6043 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Help file notes for upgrading VTScada/VTS can be found at:

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A cross-site scripting vulnerability may allow JavaScript code supplied by the attacker to execute within the user's browser.CVE-2017-6053 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.5 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Help file notes for upgrading VTScada/VTS can be found at:

cwe.name: Exposure of Information Through Directory Listing

notes.text: Some files are exposed within the web server application to unauthenticated users. These files may contain sensitive configuration information.CVE-2017-6045 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary
